Class Polygon

java.lang.Object
  Polygon

public class Polygon
extends java.lang.Object

A Polygon object represents a regular geometric shape such as an equilateral triangle, a square or a hexagon. The shape represented by a Polygon can be drawn by a Turtle or even a Bale of Turtles.

Constructor Summary
Polygon(int numberOfSides, int lengthOfSide)
          Create a polygon of "numberOfSides" sides of length "lengthOfSide".
Polygon(int numberOfSides, int lengthOfSide, Polygon p)
          Create a polygon of "numberOfSides" sides of length "lengthOfSide" with a polygon "p" at each point.
 
Method Summary
 int getInteriorAngle()
          Obtain the interior angle of this polygon.
 int getLengthOfSide()
          Obtain the length of side of this polygon.
 boolean isVisible()
          Indicate whether this polygon is visible or invisible.
 void setColor(java.awt.Color c)
          Set this polygon to be colour "c".
 void setVisible(boolean value)
          Set whether this polygon is visible to "value".
 void traceWith(Bale b)
          Instruct each Turtle within bale "b" to draw this polygon.
 void traceWith(Turtle t)
          Instruct "t" to draw this polygon.
